body:
@gertcuykens : 
- I don't work for Google
- I never had the problems Google has
- I think it's a bad idea because of the many reasons I've expressed above
- I can't work on a problem which I think it's a bad idea just because I have to do it

Also, nobody else but Google showed up saying they have a refactoring problem because of missing alias support and even funnier, googlers are against this feature, which should tell you something.

I also would immediately start questioning why we've got to the problem in the first place and how can we prevent it. Fixing the cause of a problem is better than fixing the effects of a problem as that means you can prevent the problem from happening again.
